snippet.title: Basketball star Wells settles suit against Xavier
snippet.description: A former Xavier University basketball player who was expelled over what he says was a false rape allegation has settled his lawsuit against the Cincinnati school over its handling of the case.

snippet.title: U.S. Grant was the great hero of the Civil War but lost favor with historians
snippet.description: A general little honored today was, with Lincoln, the man who saved the Union.

snippet.title: Fake mayoral Twitter account yields no charges
snippet.description: No charges will be filed over a fake Twitter account that purported to be a central Illinois mayor's lewd thoughts on sex and drugs.

snippet.title: China set to punish web giant Sina for pornography
snippet.description: China plans to revoke two crucial publication licenses for Sina.com, which might partially ban the web giant's operations, because obscene content was found during an anti-pornography crackdown, state media said Thursday.

snippet.title: Review: 'Hearthstone' card game is the real deal
snippet.description: Video game publishers don't take many risks with their most popular franchises.

snippet.title: DeShields: No transfer talk until after semester
snippet.description: Former North Carolina basketball star Diamond DeShields says she hasn't spoken to any schools about transferring, despite announcing last week she would leave the Tar Heels.

snippet.title: Franco calls selfies 'intimate,' not inappropriate
snippet.description: James Franco says his recent Instagram postings of him in bed - alone or not - are his way of sharing a "very kind of intimate portrait" of himself and to get people talking.

snippet.title: Five myths about Mount Everest
snippet.description: Are Sherpas the best climbers on the mountain?

snippet.title: Avril Lavigne responds to 'racist' video criticism by saying she loves Japan
snippet.description: "RACIST??? LOLOLOL!!! I love Japanese culture," Lavigne tweeted when people cried foul over her "Hello Kitty" video.
